snippet.textDisplay: Just seen the movie earlier today. It was done really well I thought. Watching this movie took me back to the days of the Sega Genesis console, and the kids who were probably seeing this Sonic character for their first time were loving it! Spoiler post-credit scene. It was great to see Jim Carrey again, and even the supporting cast like Natasha Rothwell did a great job playing their roles.
snippet.textOriginal: Just seen the movie earlier today. It was done really well I thought. Watching this movie took me back to the days of the Sega Genesis console, and the kids who were probably seeing this Sonic character for their first time were loving it! Spoiler post-credit scene. It was great to see Jim Carrey again, and even the supporting cast like Natasha Rothwell did a great job playing their roles.

snippet.textDisplay:
Regarding the whole "domestic terrorist" part of the film that's seemingly dropped - I think that this may be intentional: it highlights how anyone can be declared a "terrorist" for any reason whatsoever and most people aren't even aware of it - the reason why no one reacts to a "terrorist" walking among them is because no one really cares because the state has already declared so many people to be "terrorists" on the most flimsy of pretexts. Furthermore, the reason why no one other than Robotnik (a government contractor that has exceeding his mandate - much like "Blackwater" [or whatever else they call themselves these days...]) is hunting them is because the purpose of the "intelligence community" is to create false flags and mislead people into backing foreign wars of imperialistic aggression: they tend to leave hunting the "terrorists" to loose cannons that cause a lot of destruction in their wake because, in the end, capturing the "terrorists" isn't the end goal anyway - the goal is to create an illusion of a threat to justify conquest.


I know that the film never comes out and says any of this but one can read this implication into the events of the film - I think that it's a very subtle, yet very cutting, satire of the "war on terror" that the writers managed to sneak into a kids film without being preachy: I believe that they knew that only the most perceptive and politically-aware would catch get the message.
snippet.textOriginal:
Regarding the whole "domestic terrorist" part of the film that's seemingly dropped - I think that this may be intentional: it highlights how anyone can be declared a "terrorist" for any reason whatsoever and most people aren't even aware of it - the reason why no one reacts to a "terrorist" walking among them is because no one really cares because the state has already declared so many people to be "terrorists" on the most flimsy of pretexts.  Furthermore, the reason why no one other than Robotnik (a government contractor that has exceeding his mandate - much like "Blackwater" [or whatever else they call themselves these days...]) is hunting them is because the purpose of the "intelligence community" is to create false flags and mislead people into backing foreign wars of imperialistic aggression: they tend to leave hunting the "terrorists" to loose cannons that cause a lot of destruction in their wake because, in the end, capturing the "terrorists" isn't the end goal anyway - the goal is to create an illusion of a threat to justify conquest.


I know that the film never comes out and *says* any of this but one can read this implication into the events of the film - I think that it's a very subtle, yet very cutting, satire of the "war on terror" that the writers managed to sneak into a kids film without being preachy: I believe that they knew that only the most perceptive and politically-aware would catch get the message.

snippet.textDisplay: This movie could've had better action. It was so lacking in that department. Though it was an ok film, I expected so much crazier battles from Sonic and Dr. Robotnik. Hell, honestly, the movie should've gone full blown Chaos Arc from Sonic Adventure -- Sonic and his team vs Robonik vs Chaos! (Also, the plot wasn't that good. Sonic never got challenged as he was so powerful).
snippet.textOriginal: This movie could've had better action. It was so lacking in that department. Though it was an ok film, I expected so much crazier battles from Sonic and Dr. Robotnik. Hell, honestly, the movie should've gone full blown Chaos Arc from Sonic Adventure -- Sonic and his team vs Robonik vs Chaos! (Also, the plot wasn't that good. Sonic never got challenged as he was so powerful).

snippet.textDisplay:
Awww. I think I disagreed with almost every detailed point in this review! I never played the game and thought it was cute (and went to see it). I adored Marsden and barely tolerated Carey.

I’m good with the final score, and totally set my expectations in accordance with a video game movie so forgave a lot of the silly story beats. We just got there by entirely different paths!

Just wish we hadn’t eaten at the movie so we could’ve gone after to get Olive-ized. 😊
snippet.textOriginal:
Awww. I think I disagreed with almost every detailed point in this review! I never played the game and thought it was cute (and went to see it). I adored Marsden and barely tolerated Carey. 

I’m good with the final score, and totally set my expectations in accordance with a video game movie so forgave a lot of the silly story beats. We just got there by entirely different paths!

Just wish we hadn’t eaten at the movie so we could’ve gone after to get Olive-ized. 😊

snippet.textDisplay: Jeepers people.  It was not a great movie. I saw it once and would not go see it again.  It wasn't horrible.  It is a kids movie, not a family movie.  Light but very basic story line typical of all nastalgic character coming to earth and meeting a C rated actor stories of late.  Jim Carry was OK but not funny.  Found him annoying and I am a Jim Carry fan.  I think all this hype is all the big mouth fans that begged for a design change trying to justify their entitled butts.  Your young kids will like this movie.
snippet.textOriginal: Jeepers people.  It was not a great movie. I saw it once and would not go see it again.  It wasn't horrible.  It is a kids movie, not a family movie.  Light but very basic story line typical of all nastalgic character coming to earth and meeting a C rated actor stories of late.  Jim Carry was OK but not funny.  Found him annoying and I am a Jim Carry fan.  I think all this hype is all the big mouth fans that begged for a design change trying to justify their entitled butts.  Your young kids will like this movie.

snippet.textDisplay: "Does character design make a movie... absolutely not" ... beg to differ on that... they clearly, at least by the change in trailer, adjusted the emphasis on character based on the change, because it's not just "design" in terms of how it looks, but who the character is and what audiences take away from it / what they are engaging audiences on. Character design is everything here. It's the eponymous movie... getting the character right is getting the movie and the story right
snippet.textOriginal: "Does character design make a movie... absolutely not" ... beg to differ on that... they clearly, at least by the change in trailer, adjusted the emphasis on character based on the change, because it's not just "design" in terms of how it looks, but who the character is and what audiences take away from it / what they are engaging audiences on. Character design is everything here. It's the eponymous movie... getting the character right is getting the movie and the story right

snippet.textDisplay: The movie was literally Sonic 1; It was awesome when I went to see it yesterday: 9/10 due to the strong faithfulness of it's Sonic history references and allusions as well as Jim Carrey's legendary "comedic insanity" performance as Robotnik, but then changed to 10/10 due to considering the plot being original to some degree as well as a question that came to my mind regarding Sonic's origins of his iconic speed ability. Finally change it once more to 11/10 due to Tails appearing and a sequel coming in the end.
snippet.textOriginal: The movie was literally Sonic 1; It was awesome when I went to see it yesterday: 9/10 due to the strong faithfulness of it's Sonic history references and allusions as well as Jim Carrey's legendary "comedic insanity" performance as Robotnik, but then changed to 10/10 due to considering the plot being original to some degree as well as a question that came to my mind regarding Sonic's origins of his iconic speed ability. Finally change it once more to 11/10 due to Tails appearing and a sequel coming in the end.

snippet.textDisplay: The main problem of this movie is  that everybody forgot that sonic didn't stop on the Genesis/mega drive. Sonic adventure is a game from 1998 with about hours of cutscenes and a good story (and weird writing like every single game from that era because voice acting was something new for the industry). Everybody involved on this movie or reviewing it just talk about sonic 1 & 2 and even ignore sonic 3 that the plot was about an island floating on the sky guarded by the last of the echidnas and inside the island there is giant crystal that is "an egg of a dragon". Why people are not even raising the possibility of a movie about any of it? Or the story of chaos and the destruction of the echidnas 3000 years ago from adventure 1(1998) or the mystery of a space colony that was abandoned for 50 years from adventure 2(2001)? Why any of this is a possibility for a movie? I just want a video game movie that has the plot of the video game, not trying to put gameplay element, like rings, because it was what the writer saw on a video on youtube of the first game of the franchise.
snippet.textOriginal: The main problem of this movie is  that everybody forgot that sonic didn't stop on the Genesis/mega drive. Sonic adventure is a game from 1998 with about hours of cutscenes and a good story (and weird writing like every single game from that era because voice acting was something new for the industry). Everybody involved on this movie or reviewing it just talk about sonic 1 & 2 and even ignore sonic 3 that the plot was about an island floating on the sky guarded by the last of the echidnas and inside the island there is giant crystal that is "an egg of a dragon". Why people are not even raising the possibility of a movie about any of it? Or the story of chaos and the destruction of the echidnas 3000 years ago from adventure 1(1998) or the mystery of a space colony that was abandoned for 50 years from adventure 2(2001)? Why any of this is a possibility for a movie? I just want a video game movie that has the plot of the video game, not trying to put gameplay element, like rings, because it was what the writer saw on a video on youtube of the first game of the franchise.
